Thus have I heard.
At one time the Buddha was in the palace of the holy AvalokitÃªÅ›vara Bodhisattva on Mount Potalaka.
The mountain peaks were formed of various treasures.
Pure and stainless JambÅ«nada gold.
Maá¹‡i jewel kings and various precious treasures.
The wonderful colors and light always shine everywhere, and there are also wish-fulfilling trees.
At all times, countless numbers ofğŸ”½Surabhi cow's head sandalwood, agarwood,
kusha grass flowers, soft and pleasing to the mind,
with wonderful colors and fragrance adorning everywhere.
There are also countless hundreds of thousands of myriads of koá¹­is of nayutas of
devas, nÄgas, yaká¹£as, gandharvas, asuras, garuá¸as, kiá¹ƒnaras, mahoragas, humans, non-humans, and others who went to where the Buddha was, bowed their heads to the ground in respect,
make offerings, respect, revere, and praise.
With a single-pointed mind, join palms and listen to the Dharma in silence.
At that time, the World-Honored One said to the Brahma King:
The Tathagata's teachings are good in the beginning, middle, and end.
Their meaning is profound and their words are skillfully expressed.
They are pure and complete, without mixture, and are the characteristics of the pure practice of Brahmins.
The Dharma is taught according to the capacities of sentient beings to benefit them.
This is the one hundred and eight names of the Bodhisattva Avalokitesvara.
If there are those who hear them, for countless millions of eons they will not fall into negative rebirths.
If those people have the five heinous crimes, they will all be eliminated.
In life after life, they will attain the wisdom of remembering past lives.
The secret mantra of the one hundred and eight names of the Bodhisattva Avalokitesvara is:

NÄrÄyaá¹‡a, at that time
the Buddha told BrahmÄ and Indra:
If there are those who uphold and recite the secret mantra of the one hundred and eight names of Ä€rya AvalokiteÅ›vara Bodhisattva,
know that in life after life
they will always get to see Ä€rya AvalokiteÅ›vara.
If they always uphold it, they will attain great wealth and nobility.
They will attain wisdom, attain courage,
attain a dignified appearance, attain a wonderful voice,
attain eloquence,
attain to always know the meaning of all dharmas and enter the maá¹‡á¸ala.
Whatever they pray for, all mantras and siddhis will be accomplished.
If they recite it in the morning, they will forever be free from illness, scabies, and infectious diseases.
At the time of death, they will be reborn in the Western Land of Ultimate Bliss.
At that time the World-Honored One told BrahmÄ:
If a person upholds the names of buddhas as numerous as the sands of sixty-two koá¹­Ä«s of Ganges Rivers,
and make offerings of the four requisites for the rest of their lives.
Would the rewards they obtain be many or not?
Brahma King said, Very many, World-Honored One, very many, Well-Gone One.
The Buddha said, If a person upholds the one hundred and eight names of the holy AvalokitÃªÅ›vara Bodhisattva,
and even for a short while pays homage and makes offerings,
the rewards obtained by these two people will be exactly the same, without any difference.
Brahma King, you should know that upholding and reciting the one hundred and eight names of the holy AvalokitÃªÅ›vara Bodhisattva
will bring such immeasurable and boundless rewards of blessings and benefits.
How much more so for someone who upholds and recites it for the rest of their life?
The merits they obtain will be inexhaustible in life after life.
At that time, after the World-Honored One had spoken these words,
the Great Brahma King and the Heavenly Emperor Åšakra,
the eight groups of spiritual beings, and the entire great assembly,
having heard the Buddha's teachings, accepted them in faith and respectfully carried them out.
